Table.name: EVT_EVENT
Table.commentInRDBMS:
Event. This class enumerates all of the actions (i.e. data records, fault records, etc.) that are entered into the system against an inventory item. It is the foundation for all recorded transactions against assets and is driven in sequence by time and usage. Events can be historical in nature, can be current or can be in the future. An event has

a) a lifecycle
b) a duration
c) records completed actions for FAA purposes
d) records pending actions for FAA purposes
e) records technical log related information
f) records journey log related information

Column.name: EVENT_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: Identifies the creation database (MIM_LOCAL_DB) of the record and forms part of the record's primary key.

Column.name: EVENT_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: Unique idenifier assigned from Sequence EVENT_ID_SEQ.

Column.name: EVENT_TYPE_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to REF_EVENT_TYPE. Used to identify the subtype in the Gen-Spec Hierarchy.

Column.name: EVENT_TYPE_CD
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to REF_EVENT_TYPE. Used to identify the subtype in the Gen-Spec Hierarchy.

Column.name: STAGE_REASON_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to REF_STAGE_REASON

Column.name: STAGE_REASON_CD
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to REF_STAGE_REASON.

Column.name: EDITOR_HR_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to ORG_HR. The current editor of the event record.

Column.name: EDITOR_HR_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to ORG_HR. The current editor of the event record.

Column.name: EVENT_STATUS_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: The last recorded status of the workflow. FK to REF_EVENT_STATUS

Column.name: EVENT_STATUS_CD
Column.commentInRDBMS: The last recorded status of the workflow. FK to REF_EVENT_STATUS

Column.name: EVENT_REASON_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to REF_EVENT_REASON. Identifies main reason for event occurrence.

Column.name: EVENT_REASON_CD
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to REF_EVENT_REASON. Identifies main reason for event occurrence.

Column.name: BITMAP_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to REF_BITMAP

Column.name: BITMAP_TAG
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to REF_BITMAP

Column.name: SCHED_PRIORITY_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to REF_SCHED_PRIORITY. Identifies the priority model for task scheduling/execution.

Column.name: SCHED_PRIORITY_CD
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to REF_SCHED_PRIORITY. Identifies the priority model for task scheduling/execution.

Column.name: DATA_SOURCE_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to REF_DATA_SOURCE. Identifies the method that the system will use to retrieve actual data.

Column.name: DATA_SOURCE_CD
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to REF_DATA_SOURCE. Identifies the method that the system will use to retrieve actual data.

Column.name: NH_EVENT_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to EVT_EVENT. Corresponds to the next highest (parent) Event under which this Event is grouped.

Column.name: NH_EVENT_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to EVT_EVENT. Corresponds to the next highest (parent) Event under which this Event is grouped.

Column.name: H_EVENT_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to EVT_EVENT. Corresponds to the highest Event under which this Event is grouped.

Column.name: H_EVENT_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to EVT_EVENT. Corresponds to the highest Event under which this Event is grouped.

Column.name: EVENT_SDESC
Column.commentInRDBMS: A short label used for the event. Frequently generated by the system.

Column.name: EXT_KEY_SDESC
Column.commentInRDBMS: A field used to store an external system's PK value.

Column.name: HIST_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: Indicates if the event has already taken place.

Column.name: CONTACT_INFO_SDESC
Column.commentInRDBMS: Contact information

Column.name: SEQ_ERR_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: Indicates if the event was recorded out of chronological sequence.

Column.name: EVENT_LDESC
Column.commentInRDBMS: A long description for the event.

Column.name: EVENT_DT
Column.commentInRDBMS: Local time that the event actually ended.

Column.name: EVENT_GDT
Column.commentInRDBMS: GMT that the event actually ended.

Column.name: SCHED_START_DT
Column.commentInRDBMS: Scheduled local time to start the event.

Column.name: SCHED_START_GDT
Column.commentInRDBMS: Scheduled GMT to start the event.

Column.name: SCHED_END_DT
Column.commentInRDBMS: Scheduled local time to complete the event.

Column.name: SCHED_END_GDT
Column.commentInRDBMS: Scheduled GMT to complete the event.

Column.name: ACTUAL_START_DT
Column.commentInRDBMS: Actual local time the event started.

Column.name: ACTUAL_START_GDT
Column.commentInRDBMS: Actual GMT the event started.

Column.name: DOC_REF_SDESC
Column.commentInRDBMS: External document reference

Column.name: SUB_EVENT_ORD
Column.commentInRDBMS: Defines the hierarchy of a series of related events.

Column.name: DELTA_QT
Column.commentInRDBMS: Delta value that was used to adjust the bin quantity.

Column.name: RSTAT_CD
Column.commentInRDBMS: A physical attribute that defines the read/write access of the record.

Column.name: CREATION_DT
Column.commentInRDBMS: The database server's timestamp captured at the time the record was inserted.

Column.name: REVISION_DT
Column.commentInRDBMS: The database server's timestamp captured at the time the record was last updated.

Column.name: REVISION_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: The database identifier (MIM_LOCAL_DB) captured at the time the record was last updated. Identifies where modifications are being made in distributed Maintenix.

Column.name: REVISION_USER
Column.commentInRDBMS: The user that last modified the record. The user is either a) the user that logged into Maintenix - pushed into the database from the client or b) if the record update is not via a Maintenix application, the user is the Oracle user name that is processing the transaction.
